item.title: Report E-2024040039
item.description:
Report E-2024040039

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: FINDLAY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 26, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured by a skid and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the paint-impacted dock door floor. The damaged drum and all impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums and one (1) 95-gallon overpack and staged on site for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024030268
item.description:
Report E-2024030268

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: WALBRIDGE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 75000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 03/07/2024, at 1232 hours, personnel in the CSXT Walbridge, OH yard, discovered CHIU 258609, a loaded container of Waste Environmentally Hazardous Substance Solid N.O.S. (Benzene, Mercury UN3077 Class 9), leaking. The container was isolated and the shipper, Clean Harbors, notified. HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the container leaking from the door seam. It was presumed the release was due to a combination of an ineffective door seem and either a failure, or improper installation, of the box’s poly ethylene liner. Contractor personnel secured the package by applying additional sealant to the rear door of the container. The container was removed from the rail transportation and transported offsite via highway by the shipper. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Angel Villa 972-533-4154).

item.title: Report E-2024040043
item.description:
Report E-2024040043

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-01
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that due to the container being impacted by a sharp object while unloading, approximately 5 gallons of MAT 50 Paint Thinner (hazardous - UN1263) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, damaged jerrican, and oil-dri were placed into an 8 gallon metal drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report X-2024031412
item.description:
Report X-2024031412

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: Parma
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Steve Schmidt Operations supervisor advised a drum of UN1487, POTASSIUM NITRATE AND SODIUMNITRITE MIXTURES, 5.1, PG II, Sitting on the dock in front of door 37 was damaged and spilled on the dock floor. Steve advised that the bottom of one drum was struck by an unknown skid and caused the spill. Ste ve stated no one on the crew advised who struck and damaged the drum causing 2lbs of the product to spill on the dock floor. Steve advised that two pounds of the product was cleaned up and placed in a recovery drum along with the damage drum and placed in the Hazmat bay. Steve advised he asked his c rew several times, who struck the drum and nobody confessed. Spill was cleaned in house.

item.title: Report E-2024030586
item.description:
Report E-2024030586

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-21
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 21, 2024, one (1) 50-pound bag of UN1813 was torn in transit and released approximately three (3) cups of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized absorbents, hand tools, and a vacuum unit to remediate the UN183-impacted trailer. All waste, damaged bags, and personnel PPE were collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum which was staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024030605
item.description:
Report E-2024030605

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 8-ounces of "Unisol Liquid Red bK50" released from one 350-gallon metal tote leaking from the top. The source of the leak was a loose valve, which the terminal tightened. The release only impacted the exterior of the tote. ERTS reviewed the SDS and PPE requirements for material handling with the caller and determined that the terminal can clean the material that has been released. The collected waste was containerized into one (1) 10-gallon metal drum.
